Many historical versions in the ''[[Minecraft Launcher]]'' are labeled as "'''old_alpha'''", despite not all actually being from the Alpha development phase<ref>{{bug|MCL-9589}}</ref> (though this may be due to a more general use of the software development term "alpha"). This term may refer to:

* [[Pre-classic]], the first private development phase of ''Minecraft''.<ref>{{link|url=https://archive.org/download/Minecraft_IRC_Logs_2009/history/files/May-15-to-June-03-2009/2009-05-16.075419-0400EDT.txt.~1~|title=TigIRC logs|date=May 16, 2009, UTCâ€“4|website=Archive.org|quote=(12:07:06) notch: minecraft alpha is available. I need someone on windows, someone on mac and someone on linux!}}</ref>
* [[Java Edition Classic|Classic]], originally named "Minecraft Alpha".
* [[Indev]], where ''Minecraft'' was now "in development".
* [[Infdev]], infinite world generation development.
* [[Java Edition Alpha|Alpha]], the development phase of ''Minecraft'' preceding [[Java Edition Beta|Beta]].
